question: USA invaded Afghanistan, Harry Potter and The Sorcerer’s Stone was the top film, The Office started on TV
Novak Djokovic was deported from Australia, The Gray Report was published, A drought is declared in large parts of England
Gordon Brown was Prime Minister, Sully crash landed an airliner in the Hudson River, Michael Jackson died
Sir Elton John announces that he is to retire from touring after nearly fifty years, Harry Kane scored a hat-trick as England beat Panama 6-1, Chas from Chas and Dave died
The Wheel, hosted by Michael McIntyre, debuted on BBC 1, The Weeknd had a hit with Blinding Lights, Protests took place across the UK after the murder of George Floyd
Golfer Danny Willett won the US Masters, Andy Murray reaches number one in the world tennis rankings, Leicester City won the Premier League for the first time
Ellen MacArthur sailed solo around the world, The Prince of Wales married Camilla Parker Bowles, The Hunting Act banned hunting with dogs in England and Wales
HMV goes into administration, Oscar Pistorius murdered his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, Bedroom tax was introduced by the coalition government
The half crown ceases to be legal tender, Black Sabbath release their debut album, Martin Peters became the first player to be transferred for £200,000
Jude Bellingham was born, Maurice Gibb died, The rebuilt Bull Ring shopping centre in Birmingham is officially opened
